cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ENE of Guantanamo, Cuba and 20 miles NW of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northwest then northwest, move through the Bahamas, skirt the Florida east coast Thursday–Friday, and track up the Southeast coastline toward South Carolina and North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or just offshore of the South Carolina coast near Charleston–Myrtle Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect yet for South Carolina coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Current warnings confined to Florida east coast from North Palm Beach to the Flagler/Volusia county line (hurricane) and Keys (tropical-storm)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. Southeast coastline from Florida through Georgia and South Carolina inside or near the cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) are possible by late Friday night; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out Saturday if the core passes very near the coast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 2–4+ ft above ground level in and around Charleston Harbor, increasing if the track trends closer to shore and coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could deliver 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash flooding and river rises.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, coastal flooding at high tides, and the risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands.
